title: 108_hr178
content: The Act titled "Double Taxation Elimination and Economic Growth Act of 2003" introduces a new section in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding deductions for dividends paid by corporations. The Act "Double Taxation Elimination and Economic Growth Act of 2003" introduces a new section in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 allowing deductions for dividends paid by domestic corporations, with exceptions for certain types of dividends. No deduction is allowed under any other provision for the dividends received deduction. The Act "Double Taxation Elimination and Economic Growth Act of 2003" allows deductions for dividends paid by domestic corporations, with exceptions for certain types of dividends. No deduction is allowed under any other provision for the dividends received deduction. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in the Internal Revenue Code. The Act "Double Taxation Elimination and Economic Growth Act of 2003" allows deductions for dividends paid by domestic corporations, with exceptions for certain types of dividends. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2002. Dividends received by individuals are taxed at capital gain rates. The Act "Double Taxation Elimination and Economic Growth Act of 2003" allows deductions for dividends paid by domestic corporations, with exceptions for certain types of dividends. Subsection (h) of section 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include dividends taxed as net capital gain, defined as net capital gain increased by qualified dividend income. Qualified dividend income refers to dividends received from domestic corporations during the taxable year, excluding certain dividends. The distribution is made to a corporation exempt from tax under section 501 or 521, any dividend from a real estate investment trust qualifying under part II of subchapter M, any deduction under section 591, any dividend described in section 404(k), and any dividend on stock not meeting holding period requirements of section 246(c). The requirements of section 246(c) are not met, and any dividend taken into account as investment income under section 163(d)(4)(B). Special rules apply for nonresident aliens regarding dividends connected with a trade or business within the United States. Treatment of dividends from regulated investment companies. Treatment of dividends from regulated investment companies is addressed in section 854 of the Code. Subsection (a) of section 854 is amended to include the maximum rate of tax on dividends. Additionally, paragraph (1) of section 854(b) is amended to specify the maximum rate under section 1(h) for regulated investment companies. The maximum rate of tax on dividends from regulated investment companies is computed based on gross income, including net short-term capital gains minus net long-term capital losses from stock or securities sales. This calculation follows rules similar to those in section 1(h)(13). The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2002, including changes to the exclusion of dividends from investment income and the maximum rate under section 1(h)(13).
